Create Subdirectories with Custom Naming

dot-mk.dir.Rd

This function creates a set of subdirectories within a specified path. The names of these subdirectories are constructed using optional prefix, suffix, analysis name, and date tag parameters. It also assigns the paths of these subdirectories to global environment variables for later use.

Usage

.mk.dir(
  path,
  sub.dir,
  prefix = NULL,
  analysis.name = NULL,
  suffix = NULL,
  add.date.tag = NULL
)

Arguments

path

A character string specifying the base path where subdirectories will be created.

sub.dir

A character vector of subdirectory names to be created within the base path.

prefix

An optional character string to prefix each subdirectory name. Default is NULL.

analysis.name

An optional character string to include in the subdirectory name. Default is NULL.

suffix

An optional character string to suffix each subdirectory name. Default is NULL.

add.date.tag

An optional character string representing a date tag to be included in the subdirectory name. Default is NULL.

Details

The function constructs each subdirectory name by concatenating the prefix, subdirectory name, analysis name, suffix, and date tag, separated by underscores. If any of these parameters are NULL, they are omitted from the name construction. After creating the directories, the function assigns their paths to global environment variables named <sub_dir>.path for each subdirectory.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create subdirectories with specific naming components
.mk.dir(
  path = tempdir(),
  sub.dir = c("data", "results"),
  prefix = "project",
  analysis.name = "analysis1",
  suffix = "v1",
  add.date.tag = Sys.Date()
)

# Check the paths assigned to global environment variables
print(data.path)
print(results.path)
} # }
